page.title: 06Landscape,Moorland and Park
page.content: Bold Venture Park lies on the valley side coming to an end just before the bustling centre of Darwen. It is a popular meeting place for all Darweners in the summer months when the newly positioned swings and roundabouts allow the adults a quiet few minutes before the little ones ask to see the ducks on the pond or the rabbits and peacocks in the aviary. There is a splendid view from the monument where the pond,enclosing trees and overlooking Jubilee Tower provide the veiw from a picture book. A brook wends its way to this pond and if we rise up through the bottom and the top parks the scenery begins to change. Heather and whimberry bushes are passed on the wayside as walks either across footpath-marked grazing land or up towards the moorland and the tower.
